title: Get Lectured: University of Kentucky, Spring '25
author: Josh Niland
excerpt: The University of Kentucky College of Design’s Lectures, Exhibitions and Publications Committee in partnership with the Martin-Gatton College of Agriculture, Food and Environment’s Department of Landscape Architecture is offering a dynamic lineup of events for the Spring 2025 semester...
text: anchor Lecture poster by Daniel Livingston, Communications Director, University of Kentucky College of Design. The University of Kentucky College of Design’s Lectures, Exhibitions and Publications Committee in partnership with the Martin-Gatton College of Agriculture, Food and Environment’s Department of Landscape Architecture is offering a dynamic lineup of events for the Spring 2025 semester. Speakers for the term include Professor Carol Mason (January 29); Sung Ho Kim (March 3); Deborah Schneiderman (March 5); Brian Kelly (April 4); and James Timberlake of KieranTimberlake (April 16). Several exhibitions are also being hosted throughout the spring, so be sure not to miss the Future of Sport Summit (March 3); Timber Construction Symposium (March 14); and Shaker Village Work Weekend (March 29), as well. Want to share your school's lecture series? Send us your poster and details to connect@archinect.com.
html:
• anchor

    Lecture poster by Daniel Livingston, Communications Director, University of Kentucky College of Design.

    The University of Kentucky College of Design’s Lectures, Exhibitions and Publications Committee in partnership with the Martin-Gatton College of Agriculture, Food and Environment’s Department of Landscape Architecture is offering a dynamic lineup of events for the Spring 2025 semester.

    Speakers for the term include Professor Carol Mason (January 29); Sung Ho Kim (March 3); Deborah Schneiderman (March 5); Brian Kelly (April 4); and James Timberlake of KieranTimberlake (April 16). Several exhibitions are also being hosted throughout the spring, so be sure not to miss the Future of Sport Summit (March 3); Timber Construction Symposium (March 14); and Shaker Village Work Weekend (March 29), as well.

    Want to share your school's lecture series? Send us your poster and details to connect@archinect.com.
